issue_description: # [Docs] Update the MonetDB link in the `README.md` file ## Instructions :page_facing_up: Here are the step-by-step instructions: 1. Go to the file `/mindsdb/README.md`. 2. Find the section titled `## Database Integrations`. This section contains a table with integrations and their logos. 3. Find the below HTML tag: `` 4. Update the `href` value to this link: https://docs.mindsdb.com/data-integrations/monetdb 5. Save the changes and create a PR. ## The https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/labels/first-timers-only Label We are happy to welcome you on board! Please take a look at the rules below for first-time contributors. 1. You can solve only one issue labeled as https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/labels/first-timers-only. After that, please look at other issues labeled as https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/labels/good%20first%20issue, https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/labels/help%20wanted, or https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/labels/integration. 2. After you create your first PR in the MindsDB repository, please sign our CLA to become a MindsDB contributor. You can do that by leaving a comment that contains the following: `I have read the CLA Document and I hereby sign the CLA` Thank you for contributing to MindsDB!

Also, please sign the CLA by leaving a comment on your PR, once you create it.

Please leave this comment under your PR.

questions_generated: What is the specific change required in the `README.md` file for the MindsDB repository?
Where in the `README.md` file should you look to find the MonetDB link that needs updating?
What steps should a first-time contributor follow to make changes and submit a pull request for this issue?
What rules apply to first-time contributors regarding the issue labels in the MindsDB repository?
Why is it necessary for contributors to sign the CLA, and how should they do it?
golden_answers_generated: The specific change required is to update the `href` value of the MonetDB link in the `README.md` file from 'https://docs.mindsdb.com/data-integrations/all-data-integrations#monetdb' to 'https://docs.mindsdb.com/data-integrations/monetdb'.
You should look in the section titled `## Database Integrations` within the `README.md` file, which contains a table with integrations and their logos.

A first-time contributor should: 1) Go to the `/mindsdb/README.md` file, 2) Find and update the MonetDB link as per the instructions, 3) Save the changes, 4) Fork the repository, 5) Push the changes to their fork, 6) Create a pull request from their fork to the MindsDB repository, and 7) Sign the CLA by leaving a comment on their PR.

First-time contributors can only solve one issue labeled as 'https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/labels/first-timers-only'. After that, they should look at issues labeled as 'good first issue', 'help wanted', or 'integration'.

It is necessary for contributors to sign the CLA to become official MindsDB contributors. They should do this by leaving a comment saying 'I have read the CLA Document and I hereby sign the CLA' under their pull request in the MindsDB repository.
